{ "article_link_title" : null, "image" : { "path" : "/resourcecentre/how-to-change-a-flat-tire-block.jpg", "focal_point" : { "x" : 0.5, "y" : 0.5 }, "meta_data" : { "height" : 300, "width" : 530 } }, "article_type" : "Normal", "article_description" : null, "article_title_color" : "white", "alt" : "repairing a flat tire", "video" : null, "title" : "7-Step guide: how to change a flat tire ", "article_background" : "background-black", "article_description_color" : null, "article_title" : "7-Step guide: how to change a flat tire ", "article_link_text" : "Read more >", "article_description_shadow" : null, "article_title_shadow" : null, "article_link" : "$url('Page-Show', 'cid', 'how-to-change-a-flat-tire')$" }

{ "article_image" : null, "article_image_title" : null, "component_contents_bottom_margin" : null, "article_title" : null, "component_top_margin" : null, "component_bottom_margin" : null, "article_content" : "

2. How to check tread depth with tire tread wear bars or indicators

Some tires have built-in tread wear indicators. These raised bars—often six—are moulded into the grooves of the tire tread to mark the minimum allowable tread depth. If these indicators are worn, replace your tires right away.

3. How to check tread depth with a tire tread depth gauge

Tire tread depth gauges are a fast and easy way to determine with certainty if your tires are still safe for use or if they need to be replaced. Tire tread depth gauges are available at many gas stations, and some drivers like to keep one in the glove compartment for easy access.

  • Find the shallowest groove of the tread and insert the pin of the gauge until the base is flush with the tire.
  • Read the scale. Here’s what you might see, and what you should do:

Tread depth what to do

  • 6/32” Your tire’s tread depth is sufficient for 3-seasons but nearing minimum for a winter tire.
  • 5/32” If wet roads are a concern, consider replacing your tires.
  • 4/32” – 3/32” Seriously consider replacing your tires as soon as possible. If it’s a winter tire, 4/32” is the minimum.
  • 2/32” Your tires are legally bald and need to be replaced.

According to most manufacturers, and even the law in most provinces, your tires should be replaced when the tread depth reaches 4/32” in the winter and 2/32″ in the summer. If your tread depth wears to those levels, your tires are considered bald and a safety hazard.

Why you need tires with sufficient tread depth

Tires at or above the recommended tread depth level can give you better traction, reduced risk of punctures and the ability to push away water to help you avoid hydroplaning on wet roads.

While you’re checking tread depth on your tires, be sure to also check your tire pressure and look for signs of unusual wear as well as signs of damage and aging, such as cracks, bulges or abrasions.

content.description: 3 Reasons to choose tire storage at Kal's Tire Lodge

page-attributes.page-title: 3 Reasons to choose tire storage at Kal's Tire Lodge | Kal Tire
page-attributes.page-description: Do you need more room for the fun stuff at home, and you’re over the hauling & lifting of heavy, dirty tires? Kal’s Tire Lodge is like a year-round tire storage retreat, and we take care of the hauling and heavy lifting for you!

content.display-name: Most Popular 3-Season Light Truck or SUV Tires

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Most Popular 3-Season Light Truck or SUV Tires
Our top selection of 3-season tires for your light truck or SUV.
Our top selection of 3-season tires for your car, mini van or crossover.
Good for the mild conditions of spring, summer and fall.

Other tire dealers call these ‘all-season’ tires, but we call them 3-seasons because they offer good performance only in spring, summer and fall.

In warm temperatures, 3-season tires deliver reliable braking in wet and dry conditions, and they offer a quiet, comfortable ride as well as good fuel economy. To give a longer tread life, 3-season tires generally have a harder rubber compound, which loses grip at 7 C. The channels in the tread pattern also tend to clog with ice, snow and slush, creating a slippery surface in winter.

In fact, Kal’s Tire Testing showed on an icy road, a brand-new 3-season tire stopped in 32.3 metres, while a 75% worn winter tire stopped in 29.7 m.

{ "level1_breadcrumb_link" : "$url('Page-Show', 'cid', 'resource-centre')$", "level2_breadcrumb_link" : "$url('Page-Show', 'cid', 'services')$", "breadcrumb_page_title" : null, "level1_breadcrumb_text" : "Resource Centre", "level2_breadcrumb_text" : "Services", "breadcrumb_text" : "3 Reasons to choose tire storage at Kal's Tire Lodge" }

{ "article_image" : null, "article_image_title" : null, "component_contents_bottom_margin" : null, "article_title" : null, "component_top_margin" : null, "component_bottom_margin" : null, "article_content" : "

Where can you find your tire load index?

You should be able to find your manufacturer’s OE specs in your manual or on your door placard, where you’ll see the recommended tire size, load rating and tire pressure.

Can you use a tire with a lower load index than the original equipment specifications?

What happens if you find a tire you’d like to buy, but it has a smaller load index than your original equipment (OE) specifications? Can you use a tire with a lower load index? No.

A tire with a lower load index than your OE specifications can’t properly support the weight of your vehicle and its load (passengers and ski equipment, for example)—or the forces applied to the tire in emergency manoeuvres.

When you overload tire, you put your tire at risk of:

  • Stressing the casing and construction, especially when combined with driving on hot summer roads
  • Tire failure and blowouts

The Rubber Association of Canada’s guidelines state new tires should never be downgraded in load rating from the tires placed on a vehicle by the car manufacturer.

If you’re thinking about up-sizing, you can switch to a tire with a higher load index, because that means your tire can safely carry more weight, but you can never go down.

Are you in the market for hauling or trailer tires? Learn more in our post Ply Rating, Load Index & Load Range:Choosing the Best Tires for Hauling.

Remember when you shop for tires online at KalTire.com, you can search for tires by vehicle so we can determine tire size and load index for you! Plus, when you shop online with us, you’re only charged for your tires when the right set is installed. 

", "article_image_alt" : null, "component_bottom_border" : null, "article_video" : null }

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: 4 BFGoodrich Tires® = 2 Free CFL Tickets
Do you love Canadian football as much as we do? Then we’ve got a deal for you!
From September 3rd until October 26th (2019), get two free regular season CFL tickets when you purchase any set of four BFGoodrich passenger or light truck tires.*

It’s simple! When you buy a set of four BFGoodrich tires, we will send you a text message within 10 business days with a promo code valid for two free CFL tickets. This promo code can be used to claim two tickets to any regular season CFL game in any city during the 2019 or 2020 seasons (subject to availability).
HOW DO I REDEEM MY FREE TICKETS?

If you’ve received a promo code from us via text message, you can claim your tickets by following these simple instructions:

  • Visit the following Ticketmaster website: https://www.ticketmaster.ca/promo/55ynmt?brand=cfl

  • Select your favourite team & choose the game you’d like to see.

  • Enter your promo code in the ‘Offer Code’ section near the top of the page. Note that you must use all capital letters for your promo code. Once free tickets are unlocked, select your seats.

A Ticketmaster account is required to complete the check-out process and receive your tickets. If you have a Ticketmaster account already, simply log-in when prompted. If you do not have a Ticketmaster account, follow the instructions to create one and once complete, you will be able access your tickets. 

Looking for Ottawa Redblacks or Montreal Alouettes tickets? No problem! Follow these instructions:

  • For MTL, please call Mike Misischia, Manager of Ticket Operations at 1-514-787-2763 and provide your pomo code over the phone.

  • For OTT, click HERE to visit the OTT ticket site.

  • Enter: KALTIRE+yourpromocode (ex: KALTIRE+ H77K78Y5QH) – including the ‘+’ symbol.

  • Select your game and redeem your tickets.

 *Note that the 2020 CFL season schedule will be released on or around May 1st, 2020. If you are interested in redeeming tickets for a game in 2020, hang on to your code and put a reminder in your calendar to grab your free tickets next May using the same procedure explained above (codes will still be valid!).
I BOUGHT 4 BFGOODRICH TIRES BUT HAVEN’T RECEIVED MY PROMO CODE. HELP!

If you purchased a set of four BFGoodrich tires during the contest period and a) don’t have a cell phone or b) do have a cell phone but haven’t received a text message from us with a promo code within 10 business days of your purchase, send us an email to cfltickets@kaltire.com. We will validate your purchase and email you back with a promo code.

• VOUCHER TERMS & CONDITIONS:  * Receive a free pair of CFL regular season tickets with the purchase of a set of four (4) new BF Goodrich® passenger or light truck tires at any of the participating Kal Tire stores in Canada (excluding Quebec). Valid on purchases during the Promotional Period from Sep 3rd – Oct 26th, 2019. Products must be installed at Kal Tire on or before October 26th.  Kal Tire (the “Promotions Organizer”) will provide a unique promo code valid for two free CFL regular season tickets via SMS or email message to qualifying purchasers during the Promotional Period. SMS messages with promo codes will be provided within 10 business days of purchase. If for any reason qualified purchasers fail to receive an SMS message with their promo code, instructions for an alternative prize claiming method will be available on the contest website accessible through KalTire.com. Tickets are valid for CFL regular season games in either the 2019 or 2020 seasons (excluding the Labour Day game in Saskatchewan). Tickets are subject to availability and seating is self selected based on availability at the time of booking. Tickets have no cash value and are non-transferable. Post-season games are not eligible. Ticket prizes are awarded as one (1) prize per eligible purchase valid for two CFL regular season tickets. Unique codes provided to redeem tickets are one-time use and will be deactivated upon redemption. Online redemption and claiming of the tickets are the sole responsibility of the consumer participant. Instructions for redeeming tickets will be provided by the Promotions Organizer.  The Promotions Organizer and CFL Enterprises LP, their affiliates and each of their respective agents, employees, directors, successors, and assigns disclaims any and all liability, including property damage, personal injury or death, in connection with or arising out of the purchaser and its guest’s attendance at any CFL game as a result of receiving the free pair of CFL regular reason tickets from this promotion.
Proud to be The Official Tire Retailer of the Canadian Football League in partnership with BFGoodrich, the Official Tire of the CFL.

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Extra $75 off a set of new tires

content.description: Feature Deal March 2019

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
VOUCHER TERMS & CONDITIONS: 

Receive $75 off the purchase of a set of 4 new personal use passenger or light truck tires (offer excludes Michelin, BFGoodrich & Uniroyal). Present voucher at the time of purchase to receive discount. Tires must be purchased and installed at Kal Tire between March 4th- 31st, 2019. Discount is only available on original purchase and cannot be retroactively applied to a previous purchase. Not valid for vehicles used for commercial purposes. Maximum one voucher per vehicle. Valid at participating Kal Tire locations. Voucher has no cash value and cannot be combined with any other offer or discount except manufacturer rebates.

content.description: Feature Deal for March 2019

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: SAVE AN EXTRA $75 IF YOU ORDER AND INSTALL BEFORE APRIL 1, 2019!

As of March 4th it’s see ya later winter and bring on Spring! To celebrate and say farewell to frosty weather, throughout March we are offering an extra $75 off a set of four new tires (offer excludes Michelin, BFGoodrich & Uniroyal tires - all other sets of four new tires are eligible).

 

It gets better! This offer is available on top of manufacturer rebates—for a total savings of up to $175!

 

To take advantage of this great offer, simply claim your voucher and, when you have your tires installed, show it to a Kal Tire team member in one of two ways:

  1. 1. Print and hand-in your voucher
  2. 2. Download your voucher to a mobile device and show it in-store

CLICK HERE TO GET YOUR VOUCHER

Shopping for tires online? No problem. Just bring your voucher to your installation appointment and you’ll receive this discount at the point of purchase.


Happy Spring trails Canada!
HOT SUMMER DEALS ON NOW
Quality tires at an affordable price.

content.description: Pennzoil Promotion

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
Road trip season has arrived and we want to make sure your vehicle is ready to hit the road with special offers on oil changes all summer long.

From June 10th – August 31st, we have great deals on all types of Pennzoil oil changes at participating Kal Tire locations in Ontario.

content.description: Pennzoil Promotion

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Receive a $100USD travel credit *when you purchase a full synthetic Pennzoil motor oil change. Click HERE for more details.1

content.description: Pennzoil-Promotion

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
Save $20 on a synthetic blend Pennzoil motor oil change or save $10 on a conventional Pennzoil motor oil change with coupon*. Click HERE for details and to claim your coupon.

What’s more, when you purchase an oil service with Kal Tire, we will also provide a free inspection the critical components of your vehicle to make sure everything is looking ‘road trip ready’ before you start your journey.

Summer is the season for exploring and we want your adventure to be memorable for all the right reasons. So swing by your local Kal Tire today to take advantage of these special offers to ensure your vehicle is ready when the rubber hits the road.2

content.description: Pennzoil Promotion

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Offer terms & conditions: 1 Offer begins at 12:01AM CT on 5/1/19 and ends at 11:59PM CT on 10/31/19. Offer valid at participating Kal Tire locations in Ontario only with a qualifying Pennzoil® or Shell ROTELLA® Full Synthetic motor oil change. Void where prohibited or restricted by law. Valid while supplies last and is subject to promotional availability. No substitution or cash redemption. Limit 4 redemptions per person, household or address during the promotion period. All on-line submission forms must be completed by 11:59PM CT on 11/15/19 and be accompanied by a copy of the Installer identified and dated service invoice showing the required qualifying Pennzoil® or Shell ROTELLA® motor oil purchase (brand and product required on invoice). All mail-in submissions must be postmarked by 11/15/19 and received no later than 11/30/19. For purposes of this promotion, the reward is defined as a $100.00 USD Travel Reward Credit (“Reward”). Full value of Reward may not be able to be applied in one transaction; dependent on property chosen, dates and other variables. Reward cannot be combined with any other offers or discounts. Reward restrictions apply. Must be 18 or older to redeem. Valid credit card is required when using the Reward. Reward credits subject to separate terms and conditions of issuer. Rewards are not transferable or refundable once activated. Travel Reward Credit Codes expire at 11:59PM CT on 4/30/20. Promotion valid in the U.S. and Canada. Additional Reward specific restrictions as well as promotional terms and conditions apply. Promotion may be amended or terminated at any time without notice. See full Terms and Conditions and offer details at www.pennzoil.ca/travelon. 2 *Coupon expires 8/31/2019. Valid only on a qualifying Pennzoil® motor oil change at participating Kal Tire locations in Ontario. Original coupon required. Limit one coupon per vehicle. Coupon must be presented at time of purchase to receive discount. One-time use only. Customer is responsible for balance of service invoice. Cannot be combined with any other offer or discount. Not valid on previous purchases. Not to be sold, reproduced, or altered in any way. Cash value 1/100c. No cash back if coupon value exceeds selling price. Void where prohibited or otherwise restricted by law. Shell Canada Products may amend, rescind, or terminate this offer at any time without notice.

content.display-name: about the tests - cta - compare testing results

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: When shopping on KalTire.com, compare tire testing results to find the tire that performs the best for the conditions that matter the most to you.

Weather Conditions:

Warm and dry late spring day.

Conditions:

Dry, hot pavement with cracks in tar and undulations served as normal Canadian summer highways.

Test Performed:

Wet and Dry Braking; Wet and Dry Cornering

Seasons Tested in:

Summer

Weather Conditions:

Weather conditions were mainly sunny with some overcast cloud cover throughout the day.

Conditions:

Wet conditions, along with the help of a water truck, created the kind of highway puddles and hydroplane conditions drivers face when they hit road ruts on a cold and rainy day.

Test Performed:

Hydroplane Resistance, Wet Braking, Wet Cornering/p>

Seasons Tested in:

Winter, Summer

content.display-name: about the tests - rough winter highways

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
Weather Conditions:

Weather conditions were mainly sunny with some overcast cloud cover throughout the day.

Conditions:

Dry, cold pavement, with cracks in the tar and undulations as well as uphill and downhill stretches. An airport runway simulated a rough highway surface ideal for testing dry braking conditions in the cold.

Test Performed:

Dry Braking and Cornering

Seasons Tested in:

Winter

content.display-name: about the tests - slick intersections and black ice

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
Weather Conditions:

Winter testing was conducted in early morning and evening to avoid the influence of sun on the frozen lakes.

Conditions:

Slippery compact snow on a frozen lake mimicked icy road conditions. Pure ice on a second frozen lake mimicked slick icy intersections and patches of black ice.

Test Performed:

Ice Braking and Cornering

Seasons Tested in:

Winter

Weather Conditions:

Low morning cloud and early morning frost turned into a bright, cold and sunny day.

Conditions:

Frigid temperatures as well as ice, fog and just enough humidity on uneven pavement, with sections both bare and slushy, created the perfect opportunity to conduct a variety of tests.

Test Performed:

Slush Straight Line Stability, Slush Cornering

Seasons Tested in:

Winter

content.display-name: about the tests - gravelly side roads

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
Weather Conditions:

Warm and dry late spring day.

Conditions:

Worn and dry gravel road.

Test Performed:

Gravel Braking; Gravel Cornering

Seasons Tested in:

Summer

content.display-name: about the tests - muddy roads and trails

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
Weather Conditions:

Warm and dry late spring day.

Conditions:

Mud pit section with water added between tests to maintain consistent conditions.

Test Performed:

Mud Acceleration

Seasons Tested in:

Summer

In the braking distance test, a vehicle approached a marked line at a consistent speed and braking distance was measured in metres.

Summer Testing vs. Winter Testing
We varied our approach speeds by driving surface and by season for two reasons. First, this represents how most Canadians would normally drive on that surface in each season. Second, testing in both seasons provides an indication of how a tire's performance will be affected by road temperature.

Test Condition Summer (km/h) Winter (km/h)
Dry 100 90
Wet 100 70
Gravel 50 N/A
Snow N/A 50
Ice N/A 30

The cornering test demonstrates the lateral traction capabilities of the tire over a range of surfaces from dry to icy pavement, in both summer and winter. To test cornering performance, a vehicle was driven in a radius circle and speed was slowly and progressively increased until the tire could no longer hold the corner and would lose traction.

Summer Testing vs. Winter Testing
To understand how road surface temperatures affect the cornering performance of a tire, our cornering tests are completed in both summer conditions (dry and wet pavement, and gravel roads) and winter conditions (dry, wet and icy pavement). Please note that slush is also tested but completed in a specific slush cornering test.

The road noise of a tire was measured with a decibel meter on a marked stretch of road at a set speed. Using a decibel meter, the peak decibel level was recorded for each tire.

Summer Testing vs. Winter Testing
As road temperatures increase or decrease, road noise generally increases and decreases as well. To understand these potential changes, we test road noise in both summer and winter.

Hydroplane resistance was measured with repeated runs through a puddle that was maintained at a 4 cm depth. Starting at 80 km per hour, the speed of the vehicle was increased in 5 km per hour increments over repeated runs until the point where the tires lost traction or the vehicle reached 100 km per hour.

Summer Testing vs. Winter Testing
How a tire resists hydroplaning can be significantly influenced by the temperature of the standing water and the road surface. Consistent with our goal of testing tires in the most common Canadian driving conditions, we also test hydroplane resistance in both summer and winter.
Mud acceleration was measured with trucks accelerating from a standing start in a pit of mud to a marked finish line. The time to cover the 6 metre distance was captured for each tire.

content.display-name: about the tests - slush straight line

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Straight line stability on slush was measured by accelerating the vehicle through a large patch of loose slush and snow until traction loss occurred.

Slush cornering was tested with a corner set up with 5-7 cm of slush consistent throughout. Slush was raked in between vehicle tests to keep conditions consistent. The vehicle was driven around the corner until traction loss was observed.

Rolling resistance was measured by driving the vehicle at a consistent speed of 80 km per hour over a marked 10 km stretch of road. The average kilometres per 100 litres was then measured.

Summer Testing vs. Winter Testing
To understand how road temperature impacts a tire's performance in rolling resistance, we test in both summer and winter.
Over 500 tire tests to ensure you get the perfect tire for your vehicle.

content.display-name: about the tests - section header - tires must peform

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
Tires must perform in real-life situations. You deserve the confidence that the tires you buy can match the driving situations you encounter on a regular basis.

So, that's how all tests in Kal's Tire Testing were designed - only test real-life Canadian driving situations that could easily be encountered. From cornering on icy roads to driving on dry pavement, we have the tests to help you find the right tire for your needs.

content.display-name: about the tests - section header - tires must peform

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:

So, that's how all tests in Kal's Tire Testing were designed - only test real-life Canadian driving situations that could easily be encountered. From cornering on icy roads to driving on dry pavement, we have the tests to help you find the right tire for your needs.

content.display-name: about the tests - section header - real-life driving situations

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Kal Tire hired an independent tire testing group to find real-life driving conditions that Canadians face year-round. No hockey arenas or professional test tracks were used for testing the tires. We wanted the tires tested in Canada, in conditions we knew you would be driving in.

content.description: All about tire pressure: what you need to know.

page-attributes.page-title: All about tire pressure | Kal Tire
page-attributes.page-description: How do you find the right tire pressure for your vehicle? What are you risking when your tires are overinflated or underinflated? How do seasonal temperature swings impact inflation? Find out all you need to know about tire pressure!

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
We stock quality trailer tires that give your boat, utility or travel trailer the safest and smoothest ride possible

Trailer tires are a special service tire used for utility trailers, boat trailer and travel trailers. A free-rolling, heavy-duty constructed tire with a greater load range and tire pressure than the common passenger tire, these specially designed tires are typically stiffer and narrower to help with the demands of these tasks the tire is expected to accomplish, such as sway reduction, towing stability, and a cooler tire, resulting in a longer lifespan. Trailer Tires are not to be used on cars and trucks.

 

|  CHECK OUT OUR TIPS FOR TRAILER TIRES BELOW.

Over the last 66 years, customers have grown to trust Kal Tire for its commitment to service and integrity. Today, there are more than 250 Kal Tire stores from British Columbia to Ontario, with more opening each year. Most of the small rural locations are ‘mixed’, serving both retail and commercial customers.  Most recently, Kal Tire’s growth has been focused on ‘retail only’ stores in major urban centres. Kal Tire offers an impressive selection of tire brands on the strength of long-term relationships with a key group of manufacturers that include: Nokian Tyres, Nordman, Sumitomo, Nitto, Bridgestone / Firestone / Bandag, Michelin / BFGoodrich, Continental / General, Yokohama, BKT, Pirelli, Multi-Mile, Carlisle, Goodride and Sailun.

“If we sell it….we guarantee it!” is a sign you will see in every store. Kal Tire’s Customer Care Plan for personal-use vehicles features free tire rotation (rotating tire positions), free flat repairs, lifetime balancing on original assembly, and a 30-day no hassle replacement guarantee.

For more than 40 years Kal Tire has been manufacturing quality retread tires, having always believed that by deferring the final disposal, retreading is recycling. Retreading existing tires provides customers with a significant cost-effective alternative to buying new tires while significantly lowering environmental impact.

Kal Tire is the largest truck tire retreader in Canada. Using the Bandag process, the company is able to offer a variety of application-specific treads that provide superior fuel efficiency and tire wear. The organization has 10 Bandag retread facilities across Canada, retreading more than 370,000 tires a year.

The Mining Tire Group is one of the largest OTR retreaders globally with six OTR retreading facilities; 2 in Canada, 1 in UK, 1 in West Africa, 1 in Chile and 1 in Mexico. A retread tire solution is available to meet the needs of all earthmover tire users in any environment from the more traditional ‘smooth and groove’ form or using state-of-the-art remould technology.

Kal Tire’s commercial tire programs are designed with the sole purpose of keeping its customers competitive. A broad range of products coupled with an unmatched, 24-hour service keeps customers rolling at the lowest cost per kilometer possible. Some other benefits of partnering with Kal Tire are:

• 24-hour road service (serviced by more than 200 Kal Tire stores)

• ISO Certified retread plants (medium truck, industrial, OTR)

• CORE Safety Certification in every province we operate

• Certified training programs for every level of work (Service, Management)

• Customized billing services

• Wheel refinishing

• Customized tire programs (detailed fleet surveys, tire performance tracking, equipment cost analysis by unit number and purchasing analysis)

Other full service programs also include; Light Duty Fleet, Industrial, Small OTR and Agriculture.

Kal Tire’s Mining Tire Group is one of the world’s leading providers of mining tire management and supply.

At every stage of tire life, Kal Tire delivers proven solutions—from application-specific tire products and a proactive tire management system to technology that extends tire life and a state-of-the-art thermal conversion recycling facility. As a multi-brand dealer, Kal Tire teams lean on a vast selection of trusted brands and nearly five decades of experience as OTR tire suppliers to help customers maximize tire life and keep fleets moving.

Our 2,700 team members support service at nearly 150 mine sites on five continents—across commodities and extremes, from the oil sands of Alberta to the remote Pilbara of Australia.

With international expertise, and innovation in tooling, processes, safety and sustainability solutions, Kal Tire helps customers achieve their goals.

Kal Tire has warehouse facilities strategically located across Canada to service the more than 250 store locations. Products are distributed from the warehouses and retread plants via a dedicated fleet. This distribution system is designed to ensure customers have the product they need, when they need it.

To further enhance the distribution network, construction was completed on a container handling yard in Chilliwack, BC, and an expansion took place at the Brampton, ON, facility.

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
Accessibility policies and multi-year accessibility plan

 

This 2014 – 21 accessibility plan outlines the policies and actions that Kal Tire will put into place to improve opportunities for people with disabilities.

Statement of Commitment

Kal Tire is committed to treating all people in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence. We believe in integration and equal opportunity. We are committed to meeting the needs of people with disabilities in a timely manner, and will do so by preventing and removing barriers to accessibility and meeting accessibility requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.

 

Multi-Year Accessibility Plan

Accessibility Policies

• Develop and implement Accessibility policies.

• Share the policies with all team members and volunteers, make the policies available to the public and upon request, provide in an accessible format.

• Policies will be reviewed and updated regularly to reflect current practices of the organization.

 Jan 1, 2014 Human Resources Complete

Develop multi-year accessibility plan

• A Multi Year Accessibility Plan was developed.

• Post multi-year accessibility plan on website and provide in an accessible format, upon request.

• Review and update the plan at least once every five years.

 Jan 1, 2014 – Jan 1, 2019 Human Resources/Management Team Complete
Plan to be reviewed and updated by Jan 1, 2019

Training

• Provide training to team members, third party organizations acting on behalf of Kal Tire and volunteers on Ontario’s Accessibility laws and on the Human Rights Code as it relates to people with disabilities. Training will be provided in a way that best suits the duties of team members and volunteers.

• Keep a record of the training including dates which the training was provided and the names of team members that completed the training.

 Jan 1, 2015 & Ongoing Management Team January 1, 2015 & On-going

Part II – Information and Communications Standards
Feedback processes

• Ensure existing feedback processes are accessible to people with disabilities upon request.

 Jan 1, 2015 Management Team  
Accessible formats and communication supports

• Meet communication needs of people with disabilities.  We will consult with people with disabilities to determine their information and communication.

• Information will be provided in a timely manner and at a cost that is no more than the regular price charged to others.

 Jan 1, 2015 Management Team  
Accessible formats and communication supports

• Meet communication needs of people with disabilities.  We will consult with people with disabilities to determine their information and communication.

• Information will be provided in a timely manner and at a cost that is no more than the regular price charged to others.

 Jan 1, 2016 & Ongoing Management Team  
Emergency procedures, plans or public safety information

• Provide customers and clients with publicly available emergency information in an accessible way upon request.  We will also provide team members with disabilities with individualized emergency response information when necessary.

 Jan 1, 2012 & Ongoing Management Team Complete
Accessible websites and web content

• Websites and web content published after 2012 to conform to WCAG 2.0 Level A initially and increasing to WCAG 2.0 Level AA by Jan 1, 2021 to the extent practicable other than criteria 1.2.4 (captions) and 1.2.5 (pre-recorded audio descriptions).

 Beginning Jan 1, 2014 & ongoing through to Jan 1, 2021. Marketing Team  

Part III – Employment Standards
Recruitment, Assessment, Selection

• Notify internal and external job applicants that accommodations will be provided to support their participation in all aspects of the recruitment process.

• Notify applicants that when they are selected to participate in recruitment process accommodations will be made if requested.

• When making an offer of employment we will notify the candidate of our policies for accommodation for team members with disabilities.

 Jan 1, 2016 & Ongoing Hiring Manager  
Informing team members of supports

• Inform current team members and new hires as soon as practicable after they begin employment of policies supporting team members with disabilities.

• Keep team members current on revisions to policies/procedures relating to accommodation.

 Jan 1, 2016 Management Team  
Accessible formats and communication supports for team members

• When requested by a team member with a disability, we will consult with the team member and provide or arrange for the provision of suitable accessible formats and communication supports needed to perform the team member’s job.

 Jan 1, 2016 Management Team  
Workplace emergency response information

• When requested by a team member with a disability, we will consult with the team member and provide or arrange for the provision of suitable accessible formats and communication supports needed to perform the team member’s job.

 Jan 1, 2012 & On-going Management Team Complete
Documented individual accommodation plans / Return to Work Process

• Create a written process for the development of documented individual accommodation plans and return to work plans for team members with disabilities.

 Jan 1, 2016 Management Team  
Performance management, career development, advancement and redeployment

• Take the accessibility needs of employees with disabilities and, as applicable, individual accommodation plans, into account as part of performance management processes, when assessing performance, providing career development & advancement opportunities and considering redeployment.

 Jan 1, 2016 Management Team  

Part IV.1 – Design of Public Spaces Standards
Meet the accessibility standards for the design of public spaces when building or making major modifications to public spaces. Public spaces include:

• Outdoor paths of travel such as sidewalks, ramps, stairs, curb ramps and depressed curbs.

• Accessible off street parking.

• Service related elements such as service counters, fixed queuing lines and waiting areas.

 Jan 1, 2017 Real Estate Team  
Service Disruptions

• In the event of a service disruption, we will notify the public of the services disruption and alternatives available.

 Jan 1, 2017 Management Team  

 

For more information on the accessibility plan, or to request accessible formats of this document, please contact SVP, Business Services – Doug Lemiski

Phone: 250-542-2366

Email: Doug_lemiski@KalTire.com

Need to update your contact information?

Please contact our Support team.

Start Live Chat Phone: 1-877-525-8473
If you need to change the email address registered to your account please contact customer service on (877) 525-8473 (8am - 5pm PST, Monday - Friday)

content.display-name: The Aims of the Kal Tire Team

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: The Aims of the Kal Tire Team

content.display-name: The Aims of the Kal Tire Team

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
1. Our aim is to earn the trust of our customers by providing them with a level of quality and value of both service and products that exceeds their expectations and exceeds that available from the competition.

2. Our aim is that the career of every team member is supported by quality leadership, training, and opportunities for advancement. Our people will work safely and have the ambition, enthusiasm, and energy to be productive, efficient, and contribute to an upbeat atmosphere in the workplace.

3. Our aim is to achieve a fair profit in all of our operations.

4. Our aim is to expand our company in a deliberate and balanced fashion for the purpose of strengthening our ability to serve the customer and provide a solid future for our people. However, our rate of expansion will not be beyond our ability to finance or manage to a consistent standard of quality.

5. Our aim is to conduct ourselves with honesty and integrity, being conscious of our image and with modest respect for our successes. Our image is defined by the conduct of each of us.

6. Our aim is to build long-term relationships with our suppliers based on competitiveness, value and mutual respect of objectives.

7. Our aim is to continually improve every aspect of our company, recognizing our responsibility to our customers, each other, our communities and the environment.

In fulfilling our Aims, every team member is personally committed to ensuring every customer, every guest and every team member returns home safely.

content.display-name: Do I need a wheel alignment?

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: DO I NEED A WHEEL ALIGNMENT?

If potholes, gravel roads and other winter conditions have taken a toll on your vehicle, a wheel alignment can ensure you’re driving straight and reducing tire wear.

It doesn’t take much to knock a vehicle out of alignment: potholes, curbs and even regular everyday driving can take a toll on your vehicle’s suspension system and steering components. Ensuring your wheels are adjusted back to factory spec will help your tires wear evenly and you get the best fuel economy possible.

A wheel alignment is recommended when:

• New tires are installed

• You experience uneven tire wear, steering pull, or an off-center steering wheel

• Your vehicle has had an accident or a hard impact with a curb, potholes or road debris

• You lower or lift your vehicle

• Your vehicle drives on all-season or all-weather tires year-round, and it’s been a 1-2 years since your last alignment service

1. Precision service performed by Certified Technicians

2. Uneven tire wear inspection by Certified Technicians

content.display-name: alignment - section header - 3 signs you need an alignment

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: The most common signs of misalignment:

• It feels like your vehicle is pulling to one side while you’re driving

• Uneven tread wear on your tires

• Your front-end shimmies or vibrates after hitting a bump

• Your steering wheel is off-centered when driving straight

content.display-name: What's included in a wheel alignment

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: What's included in a wheel alignment service?

Our certified technicians will conduct an inspection for uneven tire wear and perform a precision alignment service, using state-of-the-art computerized technology. This ensures all four wheels are parallel and sitting flat on the road, and that your steering wheel is centered.

content.display-name: alignment - section header - a bigger deal than you think

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: A BIGGER DEAL THAN YOU THINK

Some signs of pothole damage are immediately apparent, some are not. With 40% of Canadian motorists showing they have experienced pothole damage this summer, a vehicle inspection is critical in identifying problems with your vehicle’s suspension.

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Our top selection of all-terrain tires for your light truck or SUV.
Serious off-road stability and on-road comfort.

content.display-name: all terrain - section header - all-terrain tires are a great

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: All-Terrain tires are a great choice for drivers who use their vehicles both on and off roads. With a slightly more aggressive tread design, all-terrain tires dig into rocky and sandy terrain and channel away water for strong off-road traction. And yet, on the road, you’ll enjoy smooth and quiet driving and good steering response.

content.display-name: all weather - LT featured product cards

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Most Popular Light Truck and SUV All-weather Tires
Our top selection of all-weather tires for your light truck or SUV.

content.display-name: all weather - P featured product cards

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Our top selection of all-weather tires for your car, mini van or crossover.

content.display-name: all weather - cta - shop all-weather tires

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Ideal for mild winter conditions & year-round use.

content.display-name: all weather - section-header - all weather tires are ideal

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
All Weather tires are ideal for drivers in urban centres, and areas that see mild winter conditions: mild temperatures and light, occasional snow. These tires bear the mountain snowflake emblem, so they’ve passed snow traction tests for performance in severe conditions.

Unlike 3-season tires, all-weather tires stay soft and give grip at temperatures above and below 7 C, so they’ve become a popular year-round tire in cities like Toronto and Vancouver, where drivers need tires to get them through mountain passes and to ski hills on weekends.

Kal’s Tire Testing showed when it comes to hard-packed snow and ice, all-weather tires don’t perform as well as winter tires, but they definitely outperform 3-seasons in winter conditions.

content.description: All about all-weather tires.

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
Unlike any other tire type available, all-weather tires were designed for reliable performance across temperatures and seasons (unlike all-season tires, which we call ‘3-seasons’).

Learn more >

content.description: Kal’s Choice for the Best Winter Tires for 2020

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Kal’s choice for the best winter tires for 2020
Kal’s choice for the best winter tires for 2020.

To help you find the best winter tires for the conditions you face, we’ve put together a list of our top-rated winter rated for 2020.

Learn more >

content.description: all-weather tires.

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
All Weather tires are ideal for drivers in urban centres, and areas that see mild winter conditions.

Learn more >
SAVE $50 on a set of Nokian WRG4 All-Weather tires.

content.display-name: all weather - section-header - all weather tires are ideal

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: NOKIAN ALL-WEATHER TIRES: FORGET THE FORECAST

With Nokian WRG4 all-weather tires, you get the safety performance of a winter tire, but you get to skip seasonal changeovers and storage.

Nokian’s year-round all-weather tires have a unique rubber compound and thick tread blocks for reliable grip across seasons, temperatures and conditions. In fact, the WRG4 bears the winter tire symbol so you know meets standards for winter driving in Canada.

Nokian all-weather tires also double as top-performing summer tires, offering proven sensitive handling and fuel economy in the warmer months. Whatever the weather, you’re ready for the road!

Did we mention they’re on sale?

From November 15 to December 31, save $50 on a set of 4 WRG4 or WRG4 SUV tires.

content.display-name: 6 Tips to Help Your Car Battery Last Longer

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: 6 Tips to Help Your Car Battery Last Longer
Kal Tire team member checking battery
Your car battery provides the energy your vehicle needs to operate.

content.display-name: Do you need a new battery?

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Do you need a new battery?
Kal Tire team member changing battery
The life cycle of most batteries is five years at best, but climate and temperature can play a big part.
Has your battery reached the end of its life?
Is your vehicle having trouble turning over? Or does it not start at all?
These are two of the more common signs you may need a new battery.

• The average life of an automotive battery is 4-5 years.

• Excessive heat accelerates chemical activity and creates internal corrosion causing permanent power loss.

•  Excessive cold puts stress on the battery.

• Making sure that you have a healthy battery will prolong its life cycle.

• DieHard batteries are 100% recyclable.
Kal Tire stocks batteries for your car, SUV, truck, RV, boat, commercial and farm vehicles.
Car, SUV and Light Truck Batteries
Kal Tire stocks batteries for your car, SUV, truck, RV, boat, commercial and farm vehicles.

content.display-name: batteries - section header - is your vehicle having troubles

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Is your vehicle having trouble turning over? Or does it not start at all?
These are two of the more common signs you may need a new battery.

content.display-name: Visit Kal Tire for your free battery test.

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Visit Kal Tire for your free battery test.
Our free battery check will tell you if you need one. And if you do, a Kal Tire technician will be sure you get the correct battery for you and your vehicle.

• The average life of an automotive battery is 4-5 years.

• If your vehicle is having troubles turning over or if it doesn't start you may need a new battery.

• Excessive heat accelerates chemical activity and creates internal corrosion causing permanent power loss.

• Excessive cold puts stress on the battery.

• Making sure that you have a healthy battery will prolong its life cycle.
Kal Tire stocks batteries for your car, SUV, truck, RV, boat, commercial and farm vehicles.

BATTERY WARRANTY: Kal Tire warrants to the original purchaser that the battery is free of defects in materials and workmanship, will function properly when its size and capacity is equal to or exceeds the manufacturer’s recommended size and capacity for the vehicle in which it is installed.   Learn more >

Kal Tire warrants to the original purchaser that the battery is free of defects in materials and workmanship, will function properly when its size and capacity is equal to or exceeds the manufacturer’s recommended size and capacity for the vehicle in which it is installed. Warranty replacement is performed only when the battery is determined to be defective due to faulty materials or workmanship (NOT MERELY DISCHARGED). The store must perform the appropriate tests with the proper test equipment to determine the true battery condition. In addition, it may be necessary to charge the battery before a determination of the battery condition can be done. When a battery is only discharged, it may become serviceable by bringing it up to full state of charge. The warranty replacement should be done with another battery of similar size and capacity.

• Improperly tested or untested batteries

• Batteries that are discharged only

• Failure caused by poor maintenance (i.e. low water caused by overcharging)

• Sulphation or dehydration from prolonged storage and non-use

• Broken cases, which include cracked cases, broken posts, pulled out side-terminals, etc.

• Batteries that are frozen or have been frozen

• Batteries damaged by explosions, fire or collisions

• Severe service vehicles are defined as vehicles 1 ton and larger, off highway applications, farm equipment and vehicles with multiple aftermarket electrical accessories such as stereos, two-way radios, laptops, navigation, sirens or beacons

• For batteries not identified in the above chart please visit a local Kal Tire to inquire about warranty coverage for specific makes, models and styles

• *Diehard Batteries are no longer available for purchase through Kal Tire locations, for warranty replacements, an equivalent battery manufacturer will be supplied

In the case that a battery fails outside of the free replacement period and below the total warranty period then it would qualify as a pro-rated warranty adjustment, the End User is responsible for the months that the battery was in service. The End User’s pro-rated monthly fee is calculated by taking the original purchase price and dividing it by the total months for which the battery is warranted. This monthly fee is then multiplied by the number of months the battery was in service, which represents the amount the customer will pay for the new battery.

Example:

A battery valued at $ 120.00 as an original purchase price, which has a warranty period of 84 months but is in service only 50 months.

The battery is pro-rated as follows:

50 months in service (usage charge)

84 Months total warranty = 59.5% worn

59.5% of $120 = $71.40

$71.40 customer’s charge for a new battery

• • Most batteries can be installed for a nominal flat fee, batteries that are located in trunk compartments, under seats, in fender wells or that require extensive removal procedures will be charged at “Book Rate” pricing based on make, model and year of vehicle.
  • • Batteries that qualify for warranty replacement within the first 12 months of use will be installed at n/c.

• • In the case of a free replacement adjustment, the battery is replaced, and the customer receives a new invoice for the replacement. The original warranty period continues until expiry from the original purchase date of the initial battery.
  • • In the case of a pro-rata adjustment, the battery is replaced, and the customer receives a new invoice for the pro-rated amount corresponding to the period of time the battery was in service. The new warranty starts from the moment the new battery is replaced.

• • All batteries sold require an environmental battery “core” charge, this charge is applied to all loose battery sales or customers that request to keep their old battery.
  • • Kal Tire will refund the battery core charge to consumers that return their used or defective product  upon providing proof of purchase from Kal Tire.
  • • Battery core charges vary dependent on the size and style of the battery.

{ "article_image" : null, "article_image_title" : "3 Ways tire speed rating impacts your safety", "component_contents_bottom_margin" : "0", "article_title" : null, "component_top_margin" : null, "component_bottom_margin" : "0", "article_content" : "

Do all four tires have to have the same tire speed rating?

For the best safety and performance, the same make and speed rating should be used on all four of your tires.

Safety

Manufacturers recommend tires with a specific speed rating based on the way your vehicle was engineered to drive. When you change the speed rating, it affects how your vehicle handles braking, cornering and the heat generated from sidewall flexing. With tires reacting differently, you’ll risk poor handling as well as unpredictable steering.

Speed

When you have tires with different speed ratings, you’re forced to drive at the maximum of the lowest-rated tire. That’s why if you get a flat and you’re using a temporary spare, rated ‘M’ or ‘N’ for 130 or 140 km/h, you have to drive for the donut, not the other three.

How do you know which speed rating is best for your vehicle? Your manufacturer will recommend the right tire speed rating in the owner’s manual, and you should also see it near the driver’s side door latch.

content.description: What’s included in a visual brake inspection?

page-attributes.page-title: What’s included in a visual brake inspection? | Kal Tire
page-attributes.page-description: Our free visual brake inspections, performed as part of all tire and vehicle services, can help keep you safe on the road and avoid costly repairs.

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: That grinding, squealing sound of metal on metal is what comes to mind when most drivers think of failing brakes.
One of the sure-fire signs your brakes are failing is a falling brake pedal.

content.display-name: You have to hit the brakes harder

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: You have to hit the brakes harder
If any one brake or axle is not performing the way it’s supposed to, you’ll have to push harder on your pedal to stop your vehicle.
Sometimes when brakes aren’t working, you’ll notice the pedal shudders and it’s often accompanied by a chattering sound as well as a steering wheel shaking back and forth.

content.display-name: You feel a pull to the left or right

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: You feel a pull to the left or right
If you’re applying the brakes and you notice a pull to the left or right, it could mean one of the vehicle’s calipers or wheel cylinders are seized.
Get your vehicle road trip ready for summer

Summer break is coming up and we want your vehicle to be adventure-ready for all the journeys of the season. Until June 30th, save $50 on all brake packages. To redeem this offer, simply present this digital voucher in-store at the time of purchase (either printed or on your mobile phone) and our team will apply the instant savings to your invoice. Happy Trails Canada!

 

Digital Voucher

We demonstrate our commitment to this by providing a supportive work environment and a corporate culture that welcomes and encourages equal opportunities for all team members.

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Kal Tire has just funded a roof made from 481 scrap rubber tires for a new horse stable at the Caravan Farm Theatre.
Kal Replay Fund helps raise the roof on new barn at Caravan Farm Theatre

All the world’s a stage and now thanks to Kal Tire, a unique outdoor theatre in Southern BC has a new roof.

Valued at approximately $21,000, Kal Tire supplied and funded materials for a new recycled tire roof that is now being used on a horse barn at Caravan Farm Theatre.

The roof is a project of the Kal’s RePlay Fund, which supports Canadian charities and non-profit organizations in covering the cost of recycled rubber products, such as playground surfaces, flooring, and roofing.

Kal’s RePlay Fund supports local community development and stimulates demand for recycled products made of scrap tires while leaving a lasting legacy in the communities where we do business, says Kal Tire President Rob Foord.

Designed to appear like slate tiles, the recycled tire roof also gives Caravan the opportunity to discuss the importance of recycled and sustainable building materials, says Caravan artistic director Estelle Shook.

 It Takes a Team to Raise a Barn

Operating on an 80-acre property in the township of Spallumcheen, 11 kilometres northwest of Armstrong in the North Okanagan, Caravan Farm Theatre is known internationally for its uniquely Canadian outdoor theatre productions.

The theatre often uses draft horses such as Clydesdales to transport patrons for its annual and often sold-out sleigh-ride shows in winter and also to move set pieces or be used as “actors” in the theatre’s summer productions.

A community effort that included a team of supporters and local businesses such as Kal Tire, the new decagonal barn has been designed to allow audiences the opportunity to get closer to Caravan’s celebrated horses.

The barn fits nine teams and offers an audience-access viewing stall as well as a tackroom and a gathering space/performance stage in the very middle, with a walkway around the centre that takes visitors past all of the horses’ heads.

The Curtain is Now Open

A grand opening celebration, Dec. 10, allowed the public and supporters to see the new barn in all its glory. Kal Tire Team members attended the ceremony, where a sign was installed to raise awareness about tire recycling.

Besides Caravan Farm Theatre, Kal’s RePlay Fund has been used to fund the new recycled rubber floor at the Okanagan Science Centre in Vernon as well as six playground surfaces made of recycled tires.

content.description: CFL 106 promotion

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: SAVE $106 ON NEW TIRES IF YOU ORDER BY DEC 1!

As a proud partner and the Official Tire Retailer of the CFL, we are excited to offer Canadians $106 off a set of 4 new tires in celebration of the 106th Grey Cup!

To take advantage of this great offer, simply claim your voucher below and provide it to a Kal Tire team member when you have your tires installed and complete your purchase. There are two methods to redeem:

  1. 1. Print and hand-in your voucher
  2. 2. Download your voucher to a mobile device and show it in-store

CLICK HERE TO GET YOUR VOUCHER

If you are shopping for tires on our website, your order is still eligible for the promotion. We are not able to redeem the amount directly to your online order but you will receive the discount at the point of purchase when you bring your voucher to your installation appointment.

Proud to be The Official Tire Retailer of the Canadian Football League.

content.description: cfl-106-cb-terms

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: • VOUCHER TERMS & CONDITIONS:  Receive $106 off the purchase of any set of 4 new personal use passenger or light truck tires. Tires must be ordered between November 23rd and December 1st, 2018 and installed at Kal Tire on or before December 15th, 2018. Present voucher at the time of purchase to receive discount. Not valid for vehicles used for commercial purposes. Maximum one voucher per vehicle. Valid at participating Kal Tire locations. Voucher has no cash value and cannot be combined with any other offer or discount.

content.description: cfl-cb-footer

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Proud to be The Official Tire Retailer of the Canadian Football League.
Gear Up For The Grey Cup!
Buy 4 MICHELIN® tires and get 2 FREE CFL tickets + you will be entered for a chance to win a trip to the Grey Cup.

content.description: CFL promotion-1

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Do you love Canadian football as much as we do? Then we’ve got a deal for you!

Until October 27th 2018, get two free regular reason CFL tickets when you purchase any set of four MICHELIN® passenger or light truck tires. Plus be automatically entered to win a VIP trip for two to Grey Cup 106 in Edmonton (estimated value $6,700 CAD!).*

*No purchase necessary. For full contest details & rules, click here.

content.description: CFL promotion-2

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: It’s simple! When you buy a set of four MICHELIN® tires, we will send you a text message within 10 business days with a promo code valid for two free CFL tickets. This promo code can be used to claim two tickets to any regular season CFL game in any city during the 2018 or 2019 seasons.

content.description: CFL promotion-3

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: How Do I Redeem My Free Tickets?

If you’ve received a promo code from us via text message, you can claim your tickets by following these simple instructions:

  1. Visit the following Ticketmaster website: https://www.ticketmaster.ca/promo/55ynmt?brand=cfl
  2. Select your favourite team & choose the game you’d like to see.
  3. Enter your promo code in the ‘Offer Code’ section near the top of the page & select your seats.
    • A Ticketmaster account is required to complete the check-out process and receive your tickets. If you have a Ticketmaster account already, simply log-in when prompted. If you do not have a Ticketmaster account, follow the instructions to create one and once complete, you will be able access your tickets.

Looking for Ottawa REDBLACKS tickets? No problem! Follow these instructions:

  1. Click HERE to visit the REDBLACKS ticket site.
  2. Enter: KALTIRE+yourpromocode (ex: KALTIRE+ H77K78Y5QH) – including the ‘+’ symbol.
  3. Select your game and redeem your tickets.

*Note that the 2019 CFL season schedule will be released on or around May 1st, 2019. If you are interested in redeeming tickets for a game in 2019, hang on to your code and put a reminder in your calendar to grab your free tickets next May using the same procedure explained above (codes will still be valid!).

content.description: CFL promotion-4

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: I BOUGHT 4 MICHELIN® TIRES BUT HAVEN’T RECEIVED MY PROMO CODE. HELP!

If you purchased a set of four MICHELIN® tires during the contest period and a) don’t have a cell phone or b) do have a cell phone but haven’t received a text message from us with a promo code within 10 business days of your purchase, send us an email to cfltickets@kaltire.com. We will validate your purchase and email you back with a promo code.

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Carbon steel rollers over cross cables. Ideal for low clearance vehicles. These cables are an economical alternative to traditional chains. Provides great emergency traction.
Tire with lightning diagonal cable chains

Carbon steel over cross cable. Ideal for low clearance vehicles. These diagonal pattern cables provide excellent emergency traction and smoother ride than Cobra Cable due to the added tire pattern coverage.
Tire with cruz lt cable tire chains
Metal rollers over cross cable. Ideal for low clearance vehicles. These cables are an economical alternative to traditional chains. Provides great emergency traction.
Tire with navigator lt square link alloy chains
3.7mm lightweight (LW) alloy square link cross patterns. European design with user friendly tightening system. Excellent continual traction.
tire with navigator square link alloy chains
3.7mm cross patterns. European designed chains with square link cross patterns. Ideal for low clearance vehicles. User-friendly tightening system.
Tire with regular twist link chains
5.5mm cross tire chains, carbon steel highway chains. NOT for use on plows, forklifts or tow trucks. Includes cam locks.
Tire with Canadian spec v-bar chains

7mm & *8mm cross tire chains. Carbon steel V-Bar reinforced. Excellent traction for extreme weather conditions and some off-road applications. Extra heavy side chain & cross chain hooks for durability. Ensure your vehicle has the clearance for these chains prior to using them.

content.display-name: changeover - section header - tips for storing tires

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
• Store tires in a protected area out of direct sunlight
  • Clean each tire and wheel with water to remove any break dust or dirt
  • Wrap each tire in a large bag, and ensure no moisture is trapped inside

Don’t have a safe place to keep your tires? Store them with us in Kal’s Tire Lodge

WHY NOT LEAVE MY WINTER TIRES ON?

Well, you could, but here’s why you should think twice.

  • Your tires will last longer
  • Season specific tires give you better handling
  • You’ll be more fuel efficient

content.description: Changeovers CTA

custom-attributes.custom-attribute:
1 set of wheels, 2 sets of tires.

Our tire technicians will remove your winter tires from your wheels and replace with your summer tires, then we’ll install your tires back on your vehicle. This tire installation service includes:

  • Tire Inspection
  • Tire Balancing
  • Tire Pressure Check

2 sets of mounted wheels and tires.

Our tire technicians will remove your winter tires and wheels from your vehicle and put your summer set on. Unlike a changeover service, we don’t remove your tires from your wheels. This tire service includes:

  • Tire Inspection
  • Tire Balancing
  • Tire Pressure Check
It’s time to remove your winter tires.

content.display-name: changeover - section header - find the right seasonal service for you

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: FIND THE RIGHT SEASONAL SERVICE FOR YOU

With each seasonal tire service, a changeover or a swap, our expert tire technicians will get you back on the road, driving safely and smoothly. Curious what the difference is between a tire changeover and a tire swap? We’ve provided an overview of each of these services below.

content.description: first section of the header

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: WHY NOT LEAVE MY WINTER TIRES ON?

Well, you could, but here’s why you should think twice.

1. Your tires will last longer

2. Season specific tires give you better handling

3. You’ll be more fuel efficient

content.display-name: changeover - section header - is it time

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: When should you remove your winter tires?

When the temperatures are above seven degrees Celsius, a snow tire wears faster. To get the most bang for your buck and maximum life from your tires, you should put away the winters when the temperatures remain consistently above seven degrees in your area. Learn more.
“You can get several seasons out of your tires if you’re consistently swapping your winter tires for summer tires as conditions improve and the weather warms.”

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Our national fleet of service trucks and technicians are available 24/7 to respond to your tire-related emergencies.​
Visit one of the 250 locations across Canada and let our trained technicians help you. The purchase of tires and tire management are two of the largest expenses in the operation of your vehicles.

Our people aim to exceed your expectations. That's our commitment to you! Kal Tire sources all the latest industry information, and combined with our custom tire programs, we help to successfully manage your equipment maintenance.
Kal Pro+ rewards Small Fleets and Owner/Operators with preferred pricing, exclusive offers and dedicated support. Join today - it’s FREE.
Kal Tire’s Mining Tire Group is one of the world’s leading providers of mining tire management and supply.
We’re proud to be Canada’s largest independent tire dealer with over 250 Kal Tire retail and commercial stores across British Columbia to Ontario.
is to continually improve every aspect of our company, recognizing our responsibility to our customers, each other, our communities and the environment.
Here to Keep You Moving Safely

Kal Tire is committed to supporting our commercial customers in keeping essential services moving for our communities.

Our commercial services are open and ready to serve you. Find a location near you.

For more information on our Commercial Programs, call us at 1-844-525-7761. We’re available Monday to Friday, 6am PST to 4pm PST (9am EST – 7pm EST).

Commercial Fleet Vehicle

If your appointment is for a fleet vehicle that has a unit number, and a corporate account with Kal Tire, please select Yes.

The better your tire matches to the application, the lower your operating costs will be.

With Kal Tire’s ability to draw from a broad and available range of products, as a customer, you can be sure that you will be receiving the tire and tread design that will deliver the lowest operating cost per kilometre.

Kal Tire is a major distributor for Bridgestone, Firestone, Michelin, Sailun, Sumitomo, Yokohama tires and Bandag retreads.

We have a complete lineup (including Michelin, Solideal, Westlake). Our products include solid rubber, press-on tires, pneumatic shaped solid tires, moulded tires, resilient tires and industrial pneumatic tires – all manufactured in various compounds with different treads and traction. This means we can be very specific about what tire is best suited for your application and budget. We also offer industrial retread solutions and repair services.

Our industrial tires and services are applicable to vehicles such as:

• Forklift tires • Aerial Access Equipment
• OTR truck tires – for waste management, metal recycling, mining operation, heavy industrial & transfer stations • Skid Steer Loader
• Graders • Aircraft Support Equipment
• Mini Excavators • Port Trailers
• Rough Terrain Forklifts • Back Hoe Loaders
• Scrapers • Compactors

 

SERVICES

Kal Tire has the equipment and the high level of competency in our people to handle a wide variety of industrial tire needs.

• Mobile solid tire sales & pressing service

• Industrial pneumatic tire sales & service

• Urethane flat-proofing

• Installation of poly load wheels and drive tires

• Fleet surveys (for industrial trucks)
Kal Tire - About Us - Commercial Stores

No other tire dealer offers a larger product selection to meet all your OTR needs.

PRODUCTS

We have a complete line-up (Michelin, Yokohama, Bridgestone, Nokian Tyres, Firestone, BKT, Maxam, Westlake). This means we can be very specific about what tread design is best suited for your application and budget. We also offer a complete line of OTR retread solutions and repair services.

SERVICES

Kal Tire has the equipment and the high level of competency in our people to handle the smallest OTR tires (loaders/graders, etc.) to the largest (like the tires we supply to the open pit mines). Many of our locations are equipped with a full Hiab service crane truck capable of handling up to 2700/49.

We also have the ability to performance track your tires. This means you can see for yourself what tire is providing the lowest operating cost per hour or per ton.

WHY SHOULD YOUR COMPANY CONSIDER RETREADING?

    • Reduce your tire operating budget an average of 40 per cent.

    • By choosing an application specific tread, you will increase fuel efficiency and wear out.

    • Retreads provide some of the best off-road and winter traction available.

    • Save the environment by recycling used casings. Seven gallons of oil is used in a retread vs. 22 gallons of oil in new.

    • The Kal Tire/Bandag Warranty backs all retreads supplied to your company.

    • Kal Tire is able to create a casing program to specifically suit your needs and retread parameters.

    • Kal offers a complete line of truck, industrial and OTR retread solutions and repair services.

PRODUCTS

Kal Tire is the leader when it comes our customers’ farm and agriculture needs. We have a broad product lineup (Michelin, Firestone, BKT, Westlake). This means we can be very specific about what tread design is best suited for your application and budget.

SERVICES

Our tires are nothing without the experience to put them on right. This ensures that you are maximizing your investment with as little down time as possible. We have fully qualified people working with state-of-the-art equipment who are fully prepared to deal with your smallest tire needs up to your largest (as large as 320/90R54).

content.description: By developing a deep understanding of what customer’s business challenges and opportunities are, Kal Tire is able to design and deliver a product and service program which will keep you ahead of your competitors.

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: By developing a deep understanding of what customer’s business challenges and opportunities are, Kal Tire is able to design and deliver a product and service program which will keep you ahead of your competitors.

Kal Tire has warehouse facilities strategically located across Canada to service the more than 250 store locations. Products are distributed from the warehouses and retread plants via a dedicated fleet. This distribution system is designed to ensure customers have the product they need, when they need it.

To further enhance the distribution network, construction was completed on a container handling yard in Chilliwack, BC, and an expansion took place at the Brampton, ON, facility.
Non-profits enhance their facilities and programs with access to recycled rubber products such as playground surfaces, flooring, and roofing.
Gift certificates valid for a free set of tires to support Canadian non-profit organizations.
At community and Kal Tire-led events, you’ll find our team members raising funds, awareness and smiles.
Supporting the communities we serve.

At Kal Tire, we care as much about your tires as we do about the places they’ll go and the people they’ll carry

Since the beginning—when we opened our first store in Vernon, BC, in 1953—Kal Tire has been committed to building a strong company as well as strong communities for our team members and customers.

In Canada, we have stores in cities and towns stretching from Victoria to the border of Quebec, and our Mining Tire Group teams are spread across five continents. To show our thanks and support the communities that have helped Kal Tire grow, our team members are always looking for ways to make a difference.

Across Canada and around the world, we support hundreds of local organizations, engage our teams in fundraising and provide funding for the use of recycled rubber products to enhance community facilities.

At Kal Tire, helping to make our communities stronger is just a part of our culture.

The Community Matching Gifts Program has become an incredible way to inspire team members to engage in community development and direct Kal Tire community funding toward the local causes that mean the most to them.

The program matches funds raised by our teams for registered charities and non-profit organizations.

It’s up to our local teams to initiate the application to Kal Tire for matching funds, so if you are interested in pursuing Kal Tire’s Community Matching Gifts Program, you’ll need to engage your local Kal Tire team directly in your fundraiser. Find stores near you.

content.display-name: Kids Help Phone – Walk So Kids Can Talk - Image
Kids Help Phone – Walk So Kids Can Talk

custom-attributes.custom-attribute: Kids Help Phone – Walk So Kids Can Talk

Over the years, hundreds of team members have raised more than $189,000 for Kids Help Phone by participating in their annual fundraiser, Walk So Kids Can Talk. Each year, Kal Tire sponsors several walk sites across Canada and we always look forward to spending the day with team and community members while helping to promote the important work of Kids Help Phone.
Kal Tire team members at a charity event

At Kal Tire, we’ve always believed it’s important for young people to prepare themselves for a successful future.One of the most important components of this preparation is to complete a level of education that provides them with a good start on achieving their career and life goals.

To give students a strong start, we award eight scholarships of $1,500 to dependents of Kal Tire team members who are pursuing post-secondary education. Scholarship funds can be applied to tuition, books and other student fees while studying.

Team members receive information each year about how to apply.
Robert Foord with children in Colombia

In 2015, the Colombia division of the Mining Tire Group set out to help make a difference in an impoverished Barranquilla neighbourhood. They discovered the Fundación Social Emanuel (Emanuel Social Foundation), which provides community social work as well as child care and early learning for nearly 125 children—both with the goal of improving the lives of families in Las Flores. 

We began supporting the school’s daily lunch program, donated funds for the construction of the dining room, and Kal Tire Colombia team members raised enough money on their own to give all of the children new school uniforms.
Helping our communities thrive, one team at a time.

Year-round, our teams strive to make a positive impact in our neighbourhoods. To inspire and enhance the fundraising efforts of local teams, Kal Tire matches funds they’ve raised through our Community Matching Gifts Program.

We’re proud to be a long-standing supporter of Kids Help Phone through Walk So Kids Can Talk, one of Kal Tire’s biggest local fundraising initiatives.

Each year, we award post-secondary scholarships to the children of team members to support career development and another generation of community-minded individuals.
